    • Method Detail

      • using

        public AccessTokenRequestAuthenticator using(ScopeFactory scopeFactory)
        Description copied from interface: AccessTokenRequestAuthenticator
        Specifies the ScopeFactory to be used during authorization request processing. This allows you to generate and assign permissions to the OAuth API client that can be checked later on subsequent requests. See ScopeFactory for more information.

        If not specified, an empty scope will be used.

        Specified by:
        using in interface AccessTokenRequestAuthenticator
        Parameters:
        scopeFactory - the ScopeFactory to be used for this authentication request.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • withTtl

        public AccessTokenRequestAuthenticator withTtl(long ttl)
        Description copied from interface: AccessTokenRequestAuthenticator
        Specifies the generated access token's time to live in seconds. If not provided the default ttl (3600 seconds) will be used.
        Specified by:
        withTtl in interface AccessTokenRequestAuthenticator
        Parameters:
        ttl - the time to live (in seconds) of this authentication request.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • setHttpServletRequest

        public AccessTokenRequestAuthenticator setHttpServletRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest httpServletRequest)

      • authenticate

        public AccessTokenResult authenticate(HttpRequest httpRequest)
        Description copied from interface: AccessTokenRequestAuthenticator
        Authenticates an OAuth-based HTTP request submitted to your application's API, returning the result of the authentication attempt. Throws a ResourceException if the request cannot be authenticated.
        Specified by:
        authenticate in interface AccessTokenRequestAuthenticator
        Parameters:
        httpRequest - either a javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest instance (if your app runs in a Servlet container) or a manually-constructed HttpRequest instance if it does not. An argument not of either type will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Returns:
        an AccessTokenResult that represents the result of the authentication attempt.
